alfredsnippet.snippet:
Fred Hoyle, The Universe: Past And Present Reflections, Ann. Rev. Astron. Astrophys. 1982. 20, p.2

"Of course, physicists never admit to 'style,' because the word brings an image of Beau Brummel to mind. Instead they talk loftily about 'principles,' a stuffed-duck posture. Style it is, and principle it is not."
alfredsnippet.name: Phys.org Post - Fred Hoyle on Style
